snippet: Harvard acknowledged this week that it had used hidden cameras to photograph classes, poking a sore spot created by the news last year that it had searched faculty members’ email accounts.
abstract: Harvard University acknowledges that as part of study on attendance at lectures, it used hidden cameras to photograph classes without telling professors or students; revelation rekindles privacy debate started in 2013 over admission by university that it had searched faculty members’ email accounts.
lead_paragraph: Harvard acknowledged this week that it had used hidden cameras to photograph classes, poking a sore spot created by the news last year that it had searched faculty members’ email accounts.

headline.main: Secret Cameras Rekindle Privacy Debate at Harvard
headline.print_headline: Secret Cameras Rekindle Privacy Debate at Harvard
